questions.text: A patient admitted with acute renal failure. Urine microscopy image shown here revealed the cause. All the following are true regarding this microscope except

options.label: D
options.text: Reflected light is used as a light source

questions.correct_answer: C. Used to demonstrate internal structures

questions.text: Choose the correct function of the structure marked in the image
Bacteriocin production occurs in which phase of the bacterial growth curve shown in the image

An urine specimen was collected and kept in the room temperature. The initial amount of bacteria in the specimen was 2000/ml. The pathogen had a generation time of 40 minutes and lag period of 60 minutes. After 3 hours, how many bacteria present in the specimen.8,000/ml
A Gram-negative pathogen isolated from wound infection is positive for a biochemical test as shown in the image. Choose the pathogen based on this clue.

A culture of bacteria is incubated with bacteriophages and then centrifuged to separate the bacterial cells from the supernatant. The supernatant above the cells is then transferred to a new culture of bacteria When the bacteriophage infected culture is plated on solid medium, 5 clones of bacteria are seen to acquire 5 new and distinct genetic traits. Which of the following best describes this phenomenon?
Image shown here is an example for
Equipment shown in the image is used to sterilize disposable plastic syringes and the method is named as cold sterilization. Name the quality control agent used for this equipment.
Choose the correct application of the item shown in the image
The equipment shown here is used to cultivate all the following organisms except
Image shown here is an example for

A 5-year-old suddenly complains of sore throat, malaise, and low-grade fever. Examination reveals a white, thick coating of the tonsils, uvula, and palate. Attempts to scrape the coating cause bleeding. Organism grows in Potassium tellurite agar and confirms the diagnosis. To demonstrate the toxigenicity of the pathogen, laboratory performed a test which is shown in the image. Choose the correct name of the procedure

A male infant developed tonic convulsions a few days after birth and was found to be hypocalcemic. Of note, he was born with a cleft palate, widely spaced eyes, and ears residing lower than normal. Cardiac defects also became apparent in the neonatal period. A lateral view chest radiograph revealed a diminished thymic shadow. What genetic defect could account for the problems seen in this child?
The complement system plays a key role in the host defense process. Which of the following components of this system is the most important in chemotaxis?

A 19-year-old college student develops a rash. She works part-time in a pediatric AIDS clinic. Her blood is drawn and tested for specific antibody to the chicken pox virus (varicella-zoster). Which of the following antibody classes would you expect to find if she is immune to chicken pox?
Persons with helminth infections mount immunologic responses that involve IgE and eosinophils. Which two cytokines are most important for these responses to occur

options.label: C
options.text: IL-10 and transforming growth factor beta (TGF-?)

questions.text: In a laboratory, while performing antibody detection from a patient, the antibody titre shown in Zone 1 leads to
Idiotypic variation of immunoglobulin is
Interpret the test shown in the image

A Gram positive cocci isolated from surgical site wound infection exhibits coagulase test positive. Culture on blood agar shown in the image. All the following are the virulent factors of this pathogen except

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of multiple yellowish lesions on his face and neck. He is up to date on his immunizations. Physical examination shows many lesions, up to 4 cm in diameter, with yellow crusting on the surface. There are also other sites with small blisters and with areas oozing small amounts of clear fluid. Gram stain of the fluid shown in the image. Which of the following is the most common sequelae of this infection?
Choose the correct biotype of Corynebacterium diphtheriae which produces Daisy head colonies

A bacterial pathogen was isolated from a cutaneous lesion as shown in the image. Gram smear shows typical Box car appearance of Gram-Positive bacilli. The pathogen responsible for this patient’s condition produces a toxin with which of the following mechanisms of action?

options.label: A
options.text: Acts on EF2 and inhibits protein synthesis

questions.text: A 7-day-old infant presents to the Pediatric OPD with a fever, poor feeding, and a bulging fontanelle. During her physical examination, she begins to convulse. CSF microscopy revealed motile bacilli which exhibits a typical growth pattern in semisolid agar as shown in the image. Choose the correct motility pattern of this pathogen.

A swab obtained from gun shot wound exhibits growth in Robertson cooked meat medium. This pathogen is gram-positive, spore-forming bacilli. The pathogen exhibits a typical appearance in egg based medium as shown in the image. Choose the correct name of this reaction.

A 17-year-old female is brought to the causality with high fever and confusion. She complains of chills and myalgias, and physical examination reveals a rash with petechial hemorrhage. skin biopsy reveals the gram-negative diplococci which ferments maltose. The patient is at greatest risk for which of the following?

A 35-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 3-day history of progressive joint pain in her ankles, knees, and wrists She has had three similar episodes within the past several years. She is sexually active has multiple partners, and occasionally uses protection. Physical examination shows a diffuse petechial rash over the trunk and extensor surfaces. The ankles and knees are swollen, red. and tender with decreased range of motion, and there is tenderness over the tendon sheaths of the hands and forearms. Blood cultures are positive by using New York city medium.. Examination of joint fluid shows a white cell count of 22,000/mms. Which of the following is a characteristic of the most likely causal organism that allows it to cause recurrent infections?

options.label: B
options.text: It is resistant to complement-mediated lysis

options.label: D
options.text: Its pili undergo antigenic and phase variation

questions.correct_answer: D. Its pili undergo antigenic and phase variation

questions.text: Choose the pigment producing rapid growing atypical mycobacteria

A stool sample was taken from a 20-year-old male who presented with profuse watery diarrhea. A microbiologist identified the causative agent was V. cholerae biotype El Tor. Choose the correct enrichment medium for this pathogen.

Many urine samples for culture and sensitivity received from Nephrology ward, shows non lactose fermenting colonies in MacConkey agar and also Positive for PPA test. Name the epidemiological method shown in the image, used to identify the strain variation. Choose the correct method

A 58-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of fever, shaking chills and a productive cough. She has a history of alcohol abuse. Culture of the sputum grows gram-negative lactose-fermenting rods with a typical colony morphology as shown in the image. Chest X ray shows lobar cavitation. Choose the correct pathogen .

A 27-year-old male suddenly develops severe abdominal cramping and bloody diarrhea. The patient reports consuming undercooked ground beef four days prior to the onset of the symptoms. Pathogen shows colorless colonies in Macconkey sorbitol agar. Which of the following best describes the toxin-mediated mechanism of this disease process?

options.label: A
options.text: Depolymerization of actin filaments in gastrointestinal mucosal cells, leading to mucosal cell death

options.label: B
options.text: Increased intracellular cAMP in gastrointestinal mucosal cells, resulting in decreased absorption and increased secretion in the digestive tract

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibition of elongation factor-2 (EF-2), resulting in decreased protein synthesis in gastrointestinal mucosal cells

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of the 28S ribosomal subunit, resulting in decreased protein synthesis in gastrointestinal mucosal cells

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibition of the 28S ribosomal subunit, resulting in decreased protein synthesis in gastrointestinal mucosal cells

questions.text: A 45-year-old man abruptly develops high grade fever, shakes, a severe headache, and muscle pain. He working as a gardener and supervises water sprinklers. He initially had a dry, insignificant cough but over the next few days he developed marked shortness of breath that necessitated assisted ventilation. Culture of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid on buffered charcoal yeast extract (BCYE) show growth of a predominant organism. Which of the following is the most likely causal organism?

A 40 year old farmer who is a veterinarian on a cattle ranch comes to the physician because of malaise, drenching sweats, unexplained weight loss and weakness for the past 2 months. He also has had an intermittent fever ranging up to 39 4°C. Pathogen isolated from Bone marrow aspirate culture is commonly called as Bang’s bacillus. Choose the correct selective medium for the pathogen.

A 32-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of severe respiratory distress. His sister says that he had previously been healthy, but yesterday he began to develop sudden chills a high fever, malaise nausea and vomiting and headache. He now has chest pain, difficulty breathing cough and blood-tinged sputum. Sputum microscopy shown in the image. In Ghee broth it exhibits stalactite pattern growth. Choose the correct pathogen.

A 5-year-old child of is brought to the pediatric clinic with one week paroxysmal cough with inspiratory whoops, frequently associated with vomiting. The parents profess religious objections to childhood vaccinations, but permit withdrawal of a blood sample, which reveals a lymphocytosis of 44,000/mm3. Production of lymphocytosis, insulin secretion, and histamine sensitization are all results of which attribute of this organism?

After a week in the intensive care unit following an automobile accident, an 18-year-old college student develops increased urinary urgency, burning micturition and lower abdominal pain. His urine culture plate shown in the image which revealed the probable pathogen. What is the most likely organism causing these symptoms?

A young girl from a rural area is presented with complaints of fever, cough, and fatigue for the past 2 weeks. The physician notices that the patient is having intermittent bouts of many coughs in a single breath, followed by a deep inspiration. The parents report that this pattern of coughing had started in the past 2 days. The physician informs them that their daughter will most likely recover with only supportive care. However, for confirmation of diagnosis, a swab is obtained from the posterior nasopharynx is sent for culture for a specific organism. Which of the following culture media will be used?

options.label: B
options.text: Charcoal yeast extract with iron and cysteine

options.label: C
options.text: Chocolate agar with factors V and X

questions.text: Selective medium for the bacteria causing Andaman fever is

A 14-year-old boy with sickle cell disease presented with complaints of severe pain in the area of his right humerus. Physical examination shows no other abnormalities. A radiograph is obtained that shows lytic changes and periosteal elevation in the middle and distal humeral shaft. What is the most likely pathogen responsible for this patient's condition?

A 23-year-old woman returns from a week swimming at the beach and presents to her physician with a complaint of pain in her right ear. Physical examination reveals an area of redness extending from her right ear toward her right mandible that is warm to the touch. The patient's oropharynx is without exudates or erythema. Culture shown in the image. Choose the correct pathogen.
A pathogen isolated from a case of epiglottitis exhibits the property shown in the image. Choose the correct growth factor associated with the bacteria exhibits this property.

An 8-year-old boy was bitten by a cat. Ten hours later the bite wound is purulent and inflamed and rapidly progressive cellulitis seen. The purulent exudate is cultured and reveals gram-negative coccobacilli. Which of the following microorganisms is the most likely cause?
Human lymphocytic ehrlichiosis is caused by

A sample is taken of an ulcer in the inguinal region of a 29-year-old male who has had unprotected sex in the past few months. Intracytoplasmic inclusions are seen in the Giemsa staining Obligate intracellular parasite.. Choose the correct culture for this pathogen.

options.label: B
options.text: Charcoal yeast extract agar with cysteine and iron

options.label: D
options.text: Yolk sac of a chick embryo

questions.correct_answer: D. Yolk sac of a chick embryo

questions.text: Most sensitive test used in the diagnosis of H. pylori is
Choose the special laboratory condition needed to recover the pathogen associated with GBS which is gull wing in appearance and exhibits darting motility?
Each of the following statements concerning epidemic typhus is correct except

options.label: A
options.text: The disease is characterized by a rash.

options.label: B
options.text: The Weil-Felix test can aid in diagnosis of the disease.

options.label: C
options.text: The disease is caused by a Rickettsia

options.label: D
options.text: The causative organism is transmitted from rodents to humans by a tick.

questions.correct_answer: D. The causative organism is transmitted from rodents to humans by a tick.

questions.text: A teenager came with the complains of aching muscles and joints and mild fever. He notices a rash on the side of his upper leg as shown in the image. What is the most likely etiology and route of transmission?

A 4-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department because of fever and severe pain in her fingers and toes. Treatment with morphine is begun and the girl's symptoms are partially relieved. Physical examination shows a raised facial rash as shown in the image. A peripheral blood smear shows severe anemia, and a bone-marrow aspirate shows no erythroid precursor cells. Infection with which of the following is most likely responsible for these findings?

A novel infectious disease has become prevalent and increasingly widespread over the past 2 years. The WHO laboratory has just isolated the cause of the illness which is a virus. The virus looks like a brick-shaped complex. It consists of double-stranded enveloped DNA. which replicates in the cytoplasm via a virion-associated transcriptase This new virus would be most likely classified in which of the following families?

The NCDC, India alerted to a recent infectious outbreak in a small community in South Tamil Nadu. The report states that thirteen cases of hepatitis were confirmed within this community. Of the thirteen cases, the mortality rate is particularly high among pregnant woman. The women initially reported experiencing a varying degree of symptoms including jaundice malaise , anorexia, nausea vomiting, abdominal pain and fever. The most likely causal organism belongs to which of the following viral families?

A 30-year-old PLHIV man presents to the ophthalmologist complaining of worsening vision for the past two weeks and seeing new flashes and floaters in his right eye. He reports no pain in his right eye nor is there any redness. On ophthalmoscopic examination finding shown in the image. Choose the best test to diagnose this disease

A 12-year-old boy recently immigrated from Pakistan presents with fever, muscle pain, and weakness of the trunk. abdomen. and legs. The patient's mother says that he has not been vaccinated. Physical exam reveals fasciculation and ?accid paralysis of the lower limbs. A CSF analysis reveals lymphocytosis with normal glucose and protein levels. Throat swab reveals an RNA virus. Which of the following would most likely be destroyed by the virus in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Posterior horn cells of the spinal cord

options.label: D
options.text: Anterior horn cells of spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: D. Anterior horn cells of spinal cord

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman in her second trimester of pregnancy develops arthritic symptoms and a maculopapular rash in her trunk. Serologic tests are negative for IgM antibodies to parvovirus B 19 and measles virus, but the tests are positive for IgM antibodies to rubella virus and for IgG antibodies to measles and rubella viruses. The infant is at highest risk for having which condition?

A 27-year-old man with a history of IV drug use was found to have abnormal liver function tests. Further work-up including serologic tests for viral hepatitis show Hepatitis B surface antibody (HBsAb) negative Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) positive Hepatitis core antibodyIgG (HBcAb) positive Hepatitis B surface antibody (HBsAb) negative Hepatitis B e antibody (HBeAb) positive Hepatitis B e antigen (HBeAg) negative Which of the following statements is true regarding this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: He has recovered from HBV infection and is immune to HBV.

questions.correct_answer: C. Chronic Hepatitis with low infectivity.

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman is brought with severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting with blood, restlessness, and a bloody nose. Patient history is signi?cant for 5 days of high fever with headache, joint pain, rash, and retroorbital eye pain. Laboratory values demonstrate a 20% rise in hematocrit levels, elevated AST levels, severe thrombocytopenia, leukopenia, and a positive tourniquet test. Which of the following is the most likely etiologic agent causing this disease?

A 54-year-old man who has sex with men presents with a mass on his perianal region as shown in the image. He states the mass is itchy, tender, and burns but does not hurt. His vials are unremarkable. Physical examination of the anus reveals the ?ndings seen in the following image. The rest of his physical exam is unremarkable. The TPPA test is negative. Choose the serotype responsible for this.
Name the vaccine strain used to prevent the pathognomonic lesions of a viral disease shown in the image
A 25-year-old intern who is seronegative for VZV is exposed to a patient with chickenpox. Which treatment would be the most appropriate to prevent VZV disease in the intern?
An epidemic of nausea, vomiting, and watery diarrhea breaks out on shipboard during a cruise to the Andaman Islands. Which of the following accurately describes the most likely causal agent?
An 8-year-old girl is bitten on the face by a rabid dog. The disease progresses in an uncharacteristically rapid manner, and the patient dies. Choose the correct strategy to manage this condition
questions.correct_answer: C. Rabies Vaccine + Rig + Wound toileting

questions.text: A 9-month-old child is hospitalized with viral pneumonia. Which virus is the most likely cause?
A COVID19 vaccine image is given here. This vaccine belongs to which type?
Choose the correct virus based on the ecology shown in the image

A 15-year-old boy presents to his family physician in a small town with an acute onset of nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Hepatomegaly and icteric sclera are noted on physical exam. Alanine transferase and aspartate transferase levels are markedly elevated. Over the next 3 days, 10 more people in the same town seek medical attention with similar complaints. How is the most likely cause of this outbreak definitively diagnosed?

options.label: B
options.text: Culture of organism on MacConkey agar

options.label: C
options.text: Demonstration of IgM antibodies against the agent

questions.correct_answer: C. Demonstration of IgM antibodies against the agent

questions.text: A 5-year-old child with a history of recurrent respiratory infections presents to the emergency department with a 2-day history of fever, sore throat, nasal congestion, and violent coughing. The physician notes that the child has a loud, "barking" cough. On auscultation, there is an inspiratory stridor. Between coughing spells, the child is noted to have intercostal retractions. What is the RNA genome structure of the most common virus causing this child's illness?

A 2-year-old male presents to the emergency department for fatigue and lethargy. Upon presentation, the patient is found to be severely dehydrated. The patient's mother says that he has been having non-bloody diarrhea for a day. She also says that the patient has not received any vaccinations after 6 months and currently attends a daycare center. The responsible microbe is isolated, and its structure is analyzed. Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for the symptoms seen in this child.
Choose the correct statement

options.label: A
options.text: Zika virus vector is ixodid tick

options.label: B
options.text: Hantavirus spread by inhalation of rodent urine and feces

options.label: C
options.text: KFD is caused by bite of wild animal

options.label: D
options.text: Lyssa virus is transmitted by tick

questions.correct_answer: B. Hantavirus spread by inhalation of rodent urine and feces

questions.text: Inclusion body produced by the agent causing this clinical condition is
Seronegative infectious mononucleosis is caused by

An 12-year-old boy is taken to his pediatrician because his mother noticed a raised, scaly area on the back of his head. The physician notes that the area is approximately 5 cm in diameter with an inflamed, raised border. He collects scrapings of the area, and a mold grows on SDA. LPCB wet mount shown in the image. Which organism is most likely responsible for this patient's infection?
A severely neutropenic, immunocompromised patient presents with hemoptysis and pneumonia. Culture of Bronchial alveolar fluid on SDA shown in the image. What is the most likely causative agent?

A 30 year old florist presents with a subcutaneous lesions on the hand as shown in the image, which she thinks resulted from a thorn prick. What would be the expected structure seen in the biopsy specimen to confirm the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Long, branching hyphae with acute angles

questions.text: Fungal cells that reproduce by budding are seen in the infected tissues of patients with:

options.label: C
options.text: Tinea corporis, Tinea unguium, and Tinea versicolor

questions.text: A 32-year-old man admitted with chronic pneumonia malaise, weight loss, night sweats, chest pain, breathlessness, and hoarseness. Sputum GMS smear shown in the image. What is the most common site of dissemination for the causal organism?
A COVID19 recovered patient with uncontrolled diabetes suffers from a soft tissue infection and microbiological examination revealed the pathogen as shown in the image. Name the fungal disease
Choose the correct statement

options.label: B
options.text: Molds produce hyphae that may or may not be partitioned with cross-walls or septa.

options.label: C
options.text: Conidia are produced only by sexual reproduction

options.label: D
options.text: Most pathogenic dimorphic molds produce hyphae in the host and yeasts at 25°C.

questions.correct_answer: B. Molds produce hyphae that may or may not be partitioned with cross-walls or septa.

questions.text: A severely immunosuppressed man admitted with severe head ache and few episodes of unusual behavior. On physical examination, cutaneous lesions on his arms, torso, and legs are noted. A spinal tap is ordered. CSF Gram stain shown in the image. What is the selective medium used to confirm this pathogen?

A 27-year-old PLHIV admitted with progressively increasing dyspnea over the past 3 weeks. He also complains of a dry, painful cough, fatigue, and low-grade fever. A chest x-ray reveals bilateral symmetrical interstitial and alveolar infiltration. Which of the following agents is the most likely cause of the above?
Parasite happens to reach a place where it cannot live is defined as
A 23 year old man was admitted with liver abscess, The pus aspirate shown in the image. In microscopic examination of the pus, what would be the diagnostic form for this clinical condition.

22 year old swimmer presented with features of acute meningoencephalitis in the casualty. His CSF on wet mount microscopy shown in the picture revealed the pathogen. What is the infective form of this pathogen

An HIV-infected patient develops profuse, watery diarrhea. His physician collects stool specimens for bacterial, fungal, mycobacterial, and parasitology examination. Later that day, the clinical laboratory telephones the physician and informs her that acid-fast oocysts are observed on parasitology examination as shown in the image. Which organism most likely responsible for these infections?
A 26 year women came for gynaecological examination was found to have Colpitis macularis as shown in the image. What is etiological agent responsible for this condition?

A 40-year man, seeks medical care because of an incapacitating febrile illness of 4 days duration. On examination, the patient has a temperature of 104 °F and complains of generalized body aches and pains. Laboratory blood work reveals pancytopenia and decreased hemoglobin. A blood smear is shown in the image. Chloroquine was prescribed and, within days, the patient made a dramatic recovery. The infectious disease resident caring for the patient is recommended a combination therapy that included primaquine. Choose the appropriate justification for this prescription to the resident.

options.label: A
options.text: To treat the exoerythrocytic stages and reduce the chance of relapse

options.label: B
options.text: To prevent the emergence of resistant strains of this organism

options.label: C
options.text: To treat coinfection with a related organism

options.label: D
options.text: To prevent central nervous system manifestations

questions.correct_answer: A. To treat the exoerythrocytic stages and reduce the chance of relapse

questions.text: A 48-year-old NRI man was admitted to the hospital after complaining of fever and shortness of breath. Radiographs revealed an enlarged heart and complete blood count smear results revealed rare C-shaped trypomastigote forms. The patient was an active military duty years ago in the Panama Canal zone. The most likely parasite is:
In Balantidium coli life cycle, Human acts as a

A 52-year old man from removed an insect attached to his forearm after returning from a weekend camping trip. Image shown here revealed the insect. It act as a vector for which one of the following pathogen?
All the following Parasites are causing Transfusion Transmitted infections (TTI) except
Choose the correct pathogen causing Chiclero's ulcer

A 9-year-old boy was brought to the OPD with a prolapsed rectum. Examination of the rectum reveals small worms attached to the mucosa as shown in the image. A stool sample reveals eggs that are barrel shaped, with bipolar plugs. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
Second intermediate host for Paragonimus westermani is
Choose the correct cestode that doesn’t need an intermediate host to complete the life cycle?
A 16 year old boy came to OPD with painless terminal hematuria. Urine microscopy revealed the pathogen as shown in the image. Choose the correct infective stage of the pathogen
Name the arrow marked structure in the lifecycle of an blood fluke

A 28 year old man presents with an enlarged scrotum. The man reports that his scrotum is gradually “getting bigger.” During the medical history, he also expresses alarm that his urine appears milky—giving the physician theimpression that he is also suffering from chylous urine. Peripheral blood microscopy shown in the image. with which organism is he most likely infected?

A 9-yearold girl who appears with thin & “potbelly” of malnutrition. The paediatrician orders a fecal exam and CBC. The CBC reveals a microcytic, hypochromic anemia, and the fecal exam detects brown, oval nematode eggs as shown in the image. What was the most likely means by which this child was infected?
Autoinfection is seen in all the following helminths except
